item.title: Earth Must Die launches January 27
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Point-and-click adventure game dated.

Point-and-click adventure game Earth Must Die will launch for PC via Steam on January 27, publisher No More Robots and developer Size Five announced. A new demo is available now.

Here is an overview of the game, via No More Robots:

About

From the desk of VValak Lizardtongue, Grand Shepherd of the Tyrythian Empire:

Well this is just complete and utter bullshit.

Those idiotic, moronic Terranoids think they can just roll in here and take over my beautiful Tyrythian kingdom? The kingdom that I built from the ground up with my bare hands, and only sort of inherited from my dear, sweet, extremely dead father?

Did I mention that this is bullshit?

It’s fine though, because what they don’t realize is that I am going to make them very, very dead. Along with my trusty sidekick and childhood nursing bot Milky—please do not ask me questions about that—I will whiz over to Earth, turn it into a stinking pile of rubble, and be back home in time for a warm glass of milk before bed.

Earth Must Die is the story of my glorious rise to power (off the back of my adored father’s passing), my subsequent accidental surrender to the Terranoids, and my infamous revenge against Earth and everything it stands for.

Apparently the story is retold in the form of one of those old point and click adventure games that people gave a shit about in the 1990s, I wanna say? But in 2025. Doesn’t sound like a good idea to me, but what do I know—I’m just a benevolent, terrifying leader of worlds who everyone loves and also super respects.

I’m also not sure what the phrase “British comedy royalty” is supposed to mean, but I guess they got a bunch of “funny” fuckwits to dub over my glorious voyage to feed the Terranoids their own arseholes? Let me just copy/paste the list here so I don’t have to give them any more time and effort than they deserve:

  • Joel Fry – Vvalak Lizardtongue
  • Martha Howe-Douglas – Milky
  • Alex Horne – Major Haskit, Bentik
  • Ben Starr – Krall, Danzan
  • Tamsin Greig – Rena, Blorr, Spiffy
  • Matthew Holness – Phelonius Skwid
  • Mike Wozniak – Willip, Jobson, Druce
  • Don Warrington – Quintarian
  • Stevie Martin – Skwidbot
  • Sophie Duker – Meebap
  • Emma Fryer – Parrach, Betsy
  • Alasdair Beckett-King – Oogles, Toilet, Vacuum, Village Elder
  • Rosie Holt – Chizz, Zarlaph, Karton
  • Jon Blyth – Fnaaaarglurp, Olkus
  • Julie Nolke – Grace Flufton
  • Sam O’Leary – Ian Gard, Ripper
  • Tom Lawrinson – Tree, Needledick
  • Sally Beaumont – Glushh, Big Snake
  • David Monteith – Allus, Pfysus, Marvap, Altican, Commandant
  • Inel Tomlinson – Cecil, Zertan, Robert Droid, Skwid Guards
  • Theo Leslie – Dinny

How do I not have someone to do this for me? Anyway, apparently my magnificent story is told over a series of many hours, and you click a bunch and things happen and really I don’t care about any of this, I’m just here for the glory.

You’ll be able to experience my unbelievably cool story through something called “Steam,” which is apparently how you access experiences like this back in 2025. Sounds primitive, but I guess every civilization has to start as gross slugs crawling their way onto the banks of the future.

VValak signing off.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/earth-must-die-launches-january-27

item.title: Morkull Ascend to the Gods launches April 2
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Morkull Ragast's Rage sequel dated.

Morkull Ragast’s Rage sequel Morkull Ascend to the Gods will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on April 2, publisher Dojo System and developer Disaster Games announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Dojo System:

About

Morkull Ascend to the Gods is a 2D action video game focused on boss battles, once again taking control of the charismatic God of Death: Morkull.

Set in the original world of Morkull Ragast’s Rage, locked up and aware that he is in a new video game, you must help him escape so that he can carry out his evil plans for the world and rule by subjecting everyone to his will (yes, including you).

You will feel the power and bear the weight of being the God of Death and Darkness. A select series of battles against other henchmen, minions, and Gods that make up the Olympus of the Kingdom of Midaldus await you.

But don’t worry, don’t tremble. You won’t be alone. You’ll have Morkull (or rather, he’ll have you), who has a wide range of combos, skills, and charms that you can unlock, equip, and build to your liking before each battle.

Although you’ll also die a good handful of times.

Morkull is back!

This means that his charisma, character, and personality, along with his breaking of the fourth wall, will create a lighthearted atmosphere at all times (you’re going to need it), loaded with bad jokes, references, and memes that are very present in pop culture.

It’s like having a friend playing alongside you.

Like its predecessor, Morkull Ascend to the Gods is completely hand-drawn and animated, with great care and frame by frame. In this way, thanks to traditional animation, the characters’ movements are very natural and full of life.

Distinguished by a stylized character and a wide color palette, this time, outside of Ragast, you will be able to see and discover other environments that belong to the Kingdom of Midaldus.

Morkull is back! So get back in trouble with him and join his ranks by supporting his Machiavellian cause.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/morkull-ascend-to-the-gods-launches-april-2

item.title: Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves Season 2 DLC characters announced
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

One new character per month.

SNK has announced Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves Season 2, which will feature one new downloadable content character per month, starting with Kim Jae Hoon on January 22.

The full lineup of announced downloadable content characters is as follows, via Game*Spark:

  • January 2026 – Kim Jae Hoon
  • February 2026 – Nightmare Geese
  • March 2026 – Blue Mary
  • April 2026 – Wolfgang Krauser
  • May 2026 – Mystery Character
  • June 2026 – Mystery Character

Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/fatal-fury-city-of-the-wolves-season-2-dlc-characters-announced
